title: Ohms law - find R from capacitor discharge data

content.description: At time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the potential difference across a resistor in a circuit is <math alttext="delta V sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <msub> <mi>V</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> and the current in the resistor is <math alttext="I sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. At a later time <math alttext="t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the potential difference across the resistor is <math alttext="delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and the current in the resistor is <math alttext="I sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.
content.question: Which expression is equal to the resistance of the resistor?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V sub 1 minus delta V sub 2, and denominator I sub 1 minus I sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V sub 1, and denominator I sub 1, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator delta V sub 2, and denominator I sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator I sub 1 minus I sub 2, and denominator delta V sub 1 minus delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator I sub 1, and denominator delta V sub 1, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator I sub 2, and denominator delta V sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V sub 1 minus delta V sub 2, and denominator I sub 1 minus I sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
